bug.short_desc: RPC description can be misunderstand able

long_desc.thetext:
On http://manual.qooxdoo.org/devel/pages/communication/rpc.html
The url of service should be closed by a a slash. Because of Apache 2 SEO rules it can be problematically.
The behavior of Apache 2 is following:
If you request an url "foo/bar?" Apache sends a HTTP Code 301. That why the browser send a second request with "foo/bar/?". The problem is that the second request will be a GET instead of POST request, so php rpc will quit with a "Services require JSON-RPC" error.
The crux is that chrome (tested in 21) don't shows two requests like firebug does. It merges both request to one line. The summary tells you about a POST request, but the plain request header tells you about a GET request. There is no notice about a 301.
So I lost one hour of my life on this strange behavior of chrome + apache.
I would advise you to change the rpc example to that one.
var rpc = new qx.io.remote.Rpc( "http://localhost:8080/qooxdoo/.qxrpc/", "qooxdoo.test" );
